instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery Service
threads.message:
I got an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2.8GhZ, 16GB, mid 2014, OSX 10.15.7 with bad Akku
After replacing it came back because it shows by clicking on battery symbol "service needed..."
I replaced the accu checked, no service symbol and sent back
Now i got again with the same problem (1 day later)

I dont had password from client and tryed my SSD, no service needed, tryed with an external empty drive new installed catalina, -> no batterie service needed

I tryed to install "over" the client installation, same problem
tryed update with big sur on the client installation, same problem

ofcourse SMC and PRAM Reset already tryed

did anybody had this problem before? need help please

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery Service
threads.message:
Save client data and do fresh install on its SSD.
Is the only way to discard a software issue.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery Service
threads.message: thanks, saving client data can i use to do this time machine ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery Service
threads.message:
I suppose, if its macOS installation still work.
Is probably better to manually save only important data; pictures, documents, movies, etc.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery Service
threads.message:
the problem is still there. before i try your proposal I tryed the ssd  external from another macbook (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>) 
there is okay, no battery service

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery Service
threads.message: What macOS version gives that error?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery Service
threads.message:
the original is catalina with the error, the machine is <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015

 i cloned a backup disk and installed big sur and that gives the error as well

i tryed the disk with big sur on 
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> -> no error 
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 -> no error

now i started from thhe <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with external disk from client with big sur already
installed on the clients <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> a fresh new big sur osx

started a migration from the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> to the new installed <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>

after that again the error

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery Service
threads.message:
Big Sur is known to give this error.
You should try fresh new installation of Mojave (or High Sierra) on the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> machine.
Then upgrade to Catalina, if no previous error.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery Service
threads.message: and after upgrade if no error should i try a migration from the original catalina client disk?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Battery Service
threads.message:
ok, Problem solved, thanks for help.
I made backup from client disk
then i deleted the disk in the machine and installed new high sierra, after that i upgraded to catalina(this was original osx on client disk)
then I migrated the data from the backup(started with another machine) to the client Macbook with fresh installed Catalina
and now the "service" message is gone.
